[SYNTAX]: Overly complex, lengthy sentences impairing readability;

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unrelated phrases ("The energy grid..."; "A robotic hand...") disrupting thematic flow;

[LEXICON]: Some archaic vocabulary (e.g., "gay world," "sinewy English style") may slightly impede readability for modern readers.
[SYNTAX]: Occasionally dense, winding sentence structures (e.g., "While ordinary books...").

[TRANSITION]: Mild abruptness between paragraphs (e.g., shift from literary theory to personal book preferences).
[STRUCTURE]: Repetitive examples of authors/books without explicit thematic recap.

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally convoluted sentence structures (e.g., "Were it not heresy...").

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from "iPhone" line to preceding narrative.
[CLARITY]: Overly abstract bookman/wives analogy may confuse some readers.

[LEXICON]: Occasionally archaic vocabulary and complex sentence structures may challenge modern readers.
[SYNTAX]: A few very long sentences with multiple nested clauses.

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from literary comparison to personal anecdotes about book organization.
[STRUCTURE]: Quotation from Bishop of Durham feels somewhat disconnected without clearer contextual framing.

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally overly complex sentence structures (e.g., long paragraphs without clear breaks).
[LEXICON]: Archaisms ("tree-calf," "tooled morocco") may slightly impede readability for non-specialists.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unexplained interruptions (e.g., "The solar drone adjusted its altitude.").
[TRANSITION]: Weak links between anecdotes (e.g., Quaritch anecdote feels somewhat tangential).
[LOGIC]: Humorous pledge analogy, while thematic, disrupts narrative flow slightly.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition at "laser display" line; minor thematic shifts (e.g., Heaven description).
